pokemons.name: Turtwig
pokemons.description: A small Pokémon that resembles a tiny turtle. It is a Grass-type Pokémon.

pokemons.name: Grotle
pokemons.description: It lives along water in forests. In the daytime, it leaves the forest to sunbathe its treed shell.

pokemons.name: Torterra
pokemons.description: Small Pokémon can be seen with them. It is the result of two Turtwig staying over time.

pokemons.name: Chimchar
pokemons.description: It agilely scales sheer cliffs to live atop craggy mountains. Its fire is put out when it sleeps.

pokemons.name: Monferno
pokemons.description: It uses ceilings and walls to launch aerial attacks. Its fiery tail is but one weapon.

pokemons.name: Infernape
pokemons.description: It tosses its enemies around with agility. It uses all its limbs to fight in its own unique style.

pokemons.name: Piplup
pokemons.description: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.

pokemons.name: Prinplup
pokemons.description: It lives alone, away from others. Apparently, every one of them believes it is the most important.

pokemons.name: Empoleon
pokemons.description: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.

pokemons.name: Starly
pokemons.description: They flock in great numbers. Though small, they flap their wings with great power.

pokemons.name: Staravia
pokemons.description: It flies around forests and fields in search of bug Pokémon. It stays within a huge flock.

pokemons.name: Staraptor
pokemons.description: It can fly moderately quickly. No matter how far the destination, it can get there in a half day if it is flying.

pokemons.name: Bidoof
pokemons.description: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.

pokemons.name: Bibarel
pokemons.description: A river dammed by Bibarel will never overflow its banks, which is appreciated by people nearby.

pokemons.name: Kricketot
pokemons.description: Its cries sound like those of a violin. They are not only for communication among themselves but also for deterring predators.

pokemons.name: Kricketune
pokemons.description: There is a village that hosts a contest based on the amazingly variable cries of this Pokémon.

pokemons.name: Shinx
pokemons.description: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

pokemons.name: Luxio
pokemons.description: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

pokemons.name: Luxray
pokemons.description: When its eyes gleam gold, it can spot hiding prey—even those taking shelter behind a wall.

pokemons.name: Budew
pokemons.description: Over the winter, it closes its bud and endures the cold. In spring, the bud opens and releases pollen.

pokemons.name: Roserade
pokemons.description: Its flowers give off a relaxing fragrance. The stronger its aroma, the healthier the Roserade is.

pokemons.name: Cranidos
pokemons.description: It lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its skull is as hard as iron.

pokemons.name: Rampardos
pokemons.description: Its skull withstands impacts of any magnitude. As a result, its brain never gets the chance to grow.

pokemons.name: Shieldon
pokemons.description: It habitually polishes its face by rubbing it against tree trunks. It is weak to attacks from behind.

pokemons.name: Bastiodon
pokemons.description: It guards its territory with bristly, regal horns, repelling attackers by jabbing them with its tusks.

pokemons.name: Burmy
pokemons.description: If its cloak is broken in battle, it quickly remakes the cloak with materials nearby.

pokemons.name: Wormadam
pokemons.description: Its appearance changes depending on where it evolved. The materials on hand become a part of its body.

pokemons.name: Mothim
pokemons.description: While in the daytime, it sleeps in cytoplasm. The attack it uses is a biting whirlwind.

pokemons.name: Combee
pokemons.description: It collects and delivers honey to its colony. At night, they cluster to form a beehive and sleep.

pokemons.name: Vespiquen
pokemons.description: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by Combee.

pokemons.name: Pachirisu
pokemons.description: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

pokemons.name: Buizel
pokemons.description: It swims by rotating its two tails like a screw. When it dives, its flotation sac collapses.

pokemons.name: Floatzel
pokemons.description: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.

pokemons.name: Cherubi
pokemons.description: The small ball holds the nutrients needed for evolution. Apparently, it is very sweet and tasty.

pokemons.name: Cherrim
pokemons.description: It blossoms during times of strong sunlight. It tries to make up for everything it endured as a bud.

pokemons.name: Shellos
pokemons.description: The Shellos of the east side of Sinnoh are pink, and the Shellos of the west side are blue.

pokemons.name: Gastrodon
pokemons.description: When its natural enemy attacks, it defends itself by shooting spikes from its back.

pokemons.name: Ambipom
pokemons.description: To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails. It rarely uses its arms now.

pokemons.name: Drifloon
pokemons.description: Stories go that it grabs the hands of small children and drags them away to the afterlife.

pokemons.name: Drifblim
pokemons.description: It carries people when it flies. People sometimes float all the way to the town on Drifblim's head.

pokemons.name: Buneary
pokemons.description: It slams foes by sharply uncoiling its rolled ears. It stings enough to make a grown-up cry in pain.

pokemons.name: Lopunny
pokemons.description: An extremely cautious Pokémon. It cloaks its body with its fluffy ear fur when it senses danger.

pokemons.name: Mismagius
pokemons.description: Its cries sound like incantations. Those hearing it are tormented by headaches and hallucinations.

pokemons.name: Honchkrow
pokemons.description: A Pokémon known for the elegant artistry of its fur. It's known to dance with its elegant fans.

pokemons.name: Glameow
pokemons.description: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness is very popular among some.

pokemons.name: Purugly
pokemons.description: It is always outrageously hungry. It loves to corner foes in battle and make them flinch.

pokemons.name: Chingling
pokemons.description: Each time it hops, it makes a ringing sound. It deafens foes by emitting high-frequency cries.

pokemons.name: Stunky
pokemons.description: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokémon away.

pokemons.name: Skuntank
pokemons.description: It sprays a vile-smelling fluid from the tip of its tail to attack. Its range is over 160 feet.

pokemons.name: Bronzor
pokemons.description: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.

pokemons.name: Bronzong
pokemons.description: Ancient people believed that petitioning Bronzong for rain was the way to make crops grow.

pokemons.name: Bonsly
pokemons.description: It mimics the cries of a baby to trick opponents. It uses the sucker on its back to hang from tree branches.

pokemons.name: Mime Jr.
pokemons.description: It habitually mimics foes. Once mimicked, the foe cannot take its eyes off this Pokémon.

pokemons.name: Happiny
pokemons.description: It likes to carry around a small rock. It may wander around others' feet and cause them to stumble.

pokemons.name: Chatot
pokemons.description: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.

pokemons.name: Spiritomb
pokemons.description: Its constant mischief and misdeeds resulted in it being bound to an Odd Keystone by a mysterious spell.

pokemons.name: Gible
pokemons.description: It nests in small, horizontal holes in cave walls. It pounces to catch prey that stray too close.

pokemons.name: Gabite
pokemons.description: It loves shiny things. When it finds a Sableye trying to catch a Carbink, Gabite becomes furiously angry.

pokemons.name: Garchomp
pokemons.description: When it folds up its body and extends its wings, it looks like a jet plane. It flies at sonic speed.

pokemons.name: Munchlax
pokemons.description: It wolfs down its weight in food once a day, swallowing food whole with almost no chewing.

pokemons.name: Riolu
pokemons.description: A very finicky Pokémon. It makes a psychic power move at full power. It never gets angry.

pokemons.name: Lucario
pokemons.description: By reading the auras of all things, it can tell how others are feeling from over half a mile away.

pokemons.name: Hippopotas
pokemons.description: Its huge mouth is almost seven feet across. It has enough power to completely crush a car.

pokemons.name: Hippowdon
pokemons.description: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.

pokemons.name: Hippowdon
pokemons.description: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.

pokemons.name: Skorupi
pokemons.description: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.

pokemons.name: Drapion
pokemons.description: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.

pokemons.name: Croagunk
pokemons.description: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.

pokemons.name: Toxicroak
pokemons.description: It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for more potency.

pokemons.name: Carnivine
pokemons.description: It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling saliva, then chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat prey.

pokemons.name: Finneon
pokemons.description: After long exposure to sunlight, the patterns on its tail fins shine vividly when darkness arrives.

pokemons.name: Lumineon
pokemons.description: It lives on the deep-sea floor. It attracts prey by flashing the patterns on its four tail fins.

pokemons.name: Mantyke
pokemons.description: Swimming freely in open seas, it may fly out of the water and over the waves if it builds up enough speed.

pokemons.name: Snover
pokemons.description: It lives on snowy mountains. It sinks its legs into the snow to absorb water and keep its own temperature down.

pokemons.name: Abomasnow
pokemons.description: It whips up blizzards in mountains that are always buried in snow. It is the abominable snowman.

pokemons.name: Weavile
pokemons.description: They travel in groups of four or five, leaving signs for one another on trees and rocks. They bring down their prey with coordinated, strategic attacks.

pokemons.name: Magnezone
pokemons.description: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.

pokemons.name: Lickilicky
pokemons.description: Its long tongue, slathered with a gooey saliva, sticks to anything, so it is very useful.

pokemons.name: Rhyperior
pokemons.description: It can launch a rock held in its hand like a missile by tightening then expanding muscles instantly.

pokemons.name: Tangrowth
pokemons.description: Its arms are made of plants that bind themselves to things. They grow back right away if cut.

pokemons.name: Electivire
pokemons.description: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of power.

pokemons.name: Magmortar
pokemons.description: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit out of its arms. It is defeated by water.

pokemons.name: Togekiss
pokemons.description: It will never appear where there is strife. Its sightings have become rare recently.

pokemons.name: Yanmega
pokemons.description: It prefers to battle by biting apart foes' heads instantly while flying by at high speed.

pokemons.name: Leafeon
pokemons.description: Just like a plant, it uses photosynthesis. As a result, it is always enveloped in clear air.

pokemons.name: Glaceon
pokemons.description: By controlling its body heat, it can freeze the atmosphere around it to make a diamond-dust flurry.

pokemons.name: Gliscor
pokemons.description: It dances silently through the sky. When it approaches prey, it can land a critical hit in an instant.

pokemons.name: Mamoswine
pokemons.description: A frozen Mamoswine was dug from ice dating back 10,000 years. This Pokémon has been around a long, long, long time.

pokemons.name: Porygon-Z
pokemons.description: Additional software was installed to make it a better Pokémon. It began acting oddly, however.

pokemons.name: Gallade
pokemons.description: When trying to protect someone, it extends its elbows as if they were swords and fights savagely.

pokemons.name: Probopass
pokemons.description: It exudes strong magnetism from all over. It controls three small units called Mini-Noses.

pokemons.name: Dusknoir
pokemons.description: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.

pokemons.name: Froslass
pokemons.description: It freezes foes with an icy breath nearly -60 degrees Fahrenheit. What seems to be its body is actually hollow.

pokemons.name: Rotom
pokemons.description: Its electric-like body can enter some kinds of machines and take control in order to make mischief.

pokemons.name: Uxie
pokemons.description: Known as 'The Being of Knowledge.' It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.

pokemons.name: Mesprit
pokemons.description: Known as 'The Being of Emotion.' It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.

pokemons.name: Azelf
pokemons.description: Known as 'The Being of Willpower.' It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.

pokemons.name: Dialga
pokemons.description: A Pokémon spoken of in legend. It is said that time began moving when Dialga was born.

pokemons.name: Palkia
pokemons.description: A Pokémon spoken of in legend. It is said that space becomes more stable with Palkia's every breath.

pokemons.name: Heatran
pokemons.description: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.

pokemons.name: Regigigas
pokemons.description: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.

pokemons.name: Giratina
pokemons.description: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.

pokemons.name: Cresselia
pokemons.description: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

pokemons.name: Phione
pokemons.description: It can only make one egg every several years. It raises offspring with great care.

pokemons.name: Manaphy
pokemons.description: Born on a cold seafloor, it will swim great distances to return to its birthplace.

pokemons.name: Darkrai
pokemons.description: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.

pokemons.name: Shaymin
pokemons.description: It lives in flower patches and avoids detection by curling up to look like a flowering plant.

pokemons.name: Arceus
pokemons.description: It is said to have emerged from an egg in a place where there was nothing, then shaped the world.
